rComments: over all a decent prof with pretty fair exams. the class is comprised of two midterms and a final, the final can be worth either 50, 65 or 70% of your final grade. he does lectures and has written notes. i personally had a really hard time with his teaching and his notes, i found that they were both unclear and difficult to follow.
Hybrid format of the class is great and juggled well by the prof. Very clear explanations. Midterms are memorization-heavy but relatively easy.

He tells you exactly what will be on his exam if you go in class. Lots of memorize, but taking good notes in class + listening to the audios help. His final is cumulative, but really focused on the new material, so don't study too much of what you've seen in his first 2 midterms. Final is either worth 50, 60 or 70% and midterms 15 or 25%. Good prof
Excellent prof

Really respectful in and out of class. Gives clear info in class about what will be graded. Detailed notes online cover what theory is taught in class. There's a lot to cover in the class but with proper study habits you'll be good.

Wonderful profs that provides detailed PDF docs of his powerpoints, which he bascially paraphrases during lectures. Only reason to go to class is because he tells you exactly what is important and how itll be tested on exams and the final. Very passionate, nice prof and makes the difficult concepts easy! clear grading criteria as well!

Amazing prof, his lectures are stimulating and he has a good way "dumbing down" confusing concepts and then building up from there which makes it much easier to understand. Take good notes in his lectures because usually exactly what he says in his lectures are on his midterms/final.

Great prof! He is clear about his expectations and his exams are very fair. He provides students with excellent course notes which include everything you will need to know for the course and that you can reference for clarification! Plus he really cares about his students and wants them to succeed. I would definately recommend taking his class!

Dr. Ekker is the best professor I've ever had in all my 3 years of university. He's absolutely knowledgeable, hilarious in a wholesome cracks-Dad-jokes kind of way, and he's the kindest professor I've ever met as well. Do not ever hesitate in taking one of his classes! The content he tests on is extremely clear and he doesn't play mind games.

Ekker is great! Fair, reasonable, and willing to talk to you to boost up your final mark. He is super wholesome and hilarious in class! My only complaint is that his exams are a little too easy for how much I ended up studying for them - still not complaining!
Dr. Ekker is my favourite prof at uOttawa - knows his stuff inside and out and very willing to help you if you need it. Class is info heavy but he makes it as manageable as possible. Take if you can!

Excellent prof, always shows you what you need to know for his exams in class. Don't overthink any of his questions, they are as simple as they appear. Really nice guy and keeps lectures interesting. Would take again!

Very thorough in his lectures, and posts recordings as well. His detailed notes include everything you need to know, and you'll be fine if you study from the learning objectives. Tests are very fair, no specifics or tricks. Questions are from main topics and figures in the lectures/slides, and he will emphasize what you need to know.

Fantastic prof. He's really nice and has a sense of humor. Sometimes his wording can be a bit unclear in lectures, because he's French, BUT he provided podcasts of lectures along with lecture notes, which very clearly explain concepts. His exams are beyond fair - almost 80% class averages, with no grade curving, in a third year science course...
teacherRatingTags: ['Graded by few things', 'Amazing lectures ', 'Clear grading criteria']

rComments: This prof made me like going to class and made it really easy to learn molecular biology. His midterms were very fair and he tells you exactly what you need to know and don't need to know. I would highly recommend taking this class.

Great at teaching, very clear on what he wants you to know and what he doesn't. His grading criteria, however, is ridiculous. Get ready to see lots of unfair grading. His grading makes such little sense that it's stressful to think of any upcoming midterms or exams as a result. This class should be such an easy A, but not with this guy.

I LOVED this class. Really a great class, nothing wrong to say about it. Really clear grading criteria, there were never any surprises. He's very fair; if you think the amount of points received on a question isn't fair and if you can defend your point, he will give you the points. Had finished with an A- but he bumped me up to A. Very nice!

I love how you can study his note documents online and get all the info needed for the exam. Do the practice tests because his exams are very similar to them. His exams are worth a lot (30%) and the final 40%, so make sure you study the details. He is also available after class if you have any questions. Very respectable man, thanks Dr. Ekker!

He is very clear, provides notes in advance and records his lectures. I think this is the best instruction I have seen so far. That said, there is a lot of memorization, so you need to prepare in advance and review your notes soon after class.

Le prof est organisé et là pour aider. Il fait également une séance de révision avant chaque examen. Par contre, la correction des examens est  très stricte, et les questions qu'ils posent sont dures à comprendre des fois. Elles peuvent être abstraites, où plusieurs réponses sont théoriquement possibles.
very professional and easy
My favourite prof in the Biology department at uOttawa. Made me love molecular bio. Super clear in his lectures and expectations. Keep it up, Dr. Ekker!

For each class, he posts PDFs with all the relevant information, so you may find going to class is a waste of time. Very nice guy; cares about his students. The exams are fair (no MAJOR surprises), he does review sessions which include practice questions. 2 mid terms (30% each) and 1 final (40%). Average for both midterms were 80 and 79.

Ekker knows how to make molecular bio interesting. His test questions directly reflect the material and his study notes clear up anything you didn't understand in the lecture. He is very approachable. His lecturing is good too; he throws in anecdotes to keep things from getting dry. He finished every single class about 20 minutes early.
Everything is in his notes. study and memorize it then easy A.

Absolute best! Really really enjoyed his class. It was a mandatory class for me but I would take it as an elective in a heartbeat. He provides so many resources  and really cares about his students. His explanations are very clear and concise. One of the nicest profs at uOttawa!

Amazing prof. Makes the material interesting. No textbook needed. Exams are very fair and without surprises. Very easy to do well in his class if you give it some effort. I nominated him for prof of the year.

The absolute best prof I have ever had! He makes notes so you don't have to waste money on useless textbooks, and almost everything in class is in his notes. Class is just to supplement what is in his notes. Requires a lot of studying cause you need to know details. The work you put in is the mark you get. He is clear and emphasizes key points.

Best prof I have ever had. Crystal clear, explains well, takes his time and extremely fair exams. I just cannot describe how awesome he made a class that I had no prior interest in. His notes are pretty sweet. If you consistently put in the work, you will do fine. A BOSS
M. Ekker is a very clear, structured instructor who seems to enjoy what he does. I would recommend this prof to anyone.
not the best but good enough

His lectrure notes are very clear. Take notes as he's lecturing and you'll have all everything you need. Don't need the textbook at all - he even said so. Learning objectives at beginning of each lecture really helps you know what's important.  Explains well but can go a bit fast at times. Overall good prof. Would def take another class with him.

I did not like his teaching, nor his marking... but it wasn't awful... wouldn't recommend if you like to understand. I don't find he is clear, nor organized, and doesn't answer questions... Not very helpful...
Loved him!  Very clear, and keeps lectures interesting (a miracle in molecular bio) with his lame jokes.  Exam was very fair.
Love his jokes! And his lectues and notes are so comprehensible
Good prof, he`s notes are very very clear. He explains everything and the exam are pretty easy but there`s a lot of memorisation. Excellent prof overall
Not bad, Way too much memorisation though
